Description: Mould-made pottery oil-lamp decorated on the discus with a horned head bust in releif (wearing a wreath?). Between the wick-hole and discus-rim are small volutes. At the rear is a pierced notched handle. Base indicated by incised line surrounding pot mark of palm frond. Broken. Light red-brown Nile silt fabric with mica and white inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.33) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5879 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
